Trapper.name: Bear Oil
Trapper.description:
Melted animal fat that can lubricate the Bear Traps squeaky joints.
Setting a Bear Trap is silent.

Trapper.name: Makeshift Wrap
Trapper.description:
A scratched and worn brace made of thick, cured animal skin.
You are no longer caught in your own Bear Traps, they are automatically disarmed instead.

Trapper.name: Padded Jaws
Trapper.description:
These padded jaws are meant to restrain, not to wound.
Bear Traps immobilise Survivors without damaging them.
Grants 100 % bonus Bloodpoints for trapping Survivors.

Trapper.name: Trapper Gloves
Trapper.description:
Protective padded leather gloves.
Increases the Setting speed of the Bear Trap by +30 %.

Trapper.name: 4-Coil Spring Kit
Trapper.description:
A replacement kit for Bear Traps which changes the usual dual spring system to four coil springs, adding a great amount of strength to the Bear Traps hold.
Increases the Disarm time of the Bear Trap by +33 %.

Trapper.name: Coffee Grounds
Trapper.description:
An old rusted can containing damp coffee grounds.
Increases the strength of the Haste Status Effect after setting a Bear Trap by +5 % .

Trapper.name: Lengthened Jaws
Trapper.description:
Jaws with long teeth that dig further into the flesh than a conventional Bear Traps.
Survivors who escape from Bear Traps suffer from the Deep Wound Status Effect.

Trapper.name: Serrated Jaws
Trapper.description:
These replacement trap jaws have saw-like blades, causing awful open wounds when they snap.
Survivors injured by a Bear Trap suffer from the Haemorrhage Status Effect until fully healed.
"Like a predatory beast, it can smell and track blood."

Trapper.name: Wax Brick
Trapper.description:
A block of wax used to lower friction and facilitate movement in mechanical parts.
Increases the Rescue and Escape times of the Bear Trap by +33 %.

Trapper.name: Fastening Tools
Trapper.description:
A specialised set of tools used to fasten Bear Traps to ensure their effectiveness.
Increases the Rescue and Escape times from the Bear Trap by +25 %.
Increases the Setting speed of the Bear Trap by +50 %.

Trapper.name: Rusted Jaws
Trapper.description:
These Bear Trap jaws are covered with crusty and volatile rust spots, making injuries particularly difficult to heal.
Survivors injured by a Bear Trap suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Trapper.name: Secondary Coil
Trapper.description:
A secondary coil keeps the Bear Trap functional in times when the primary coil becomes unusable.
Increases the Disarm time of the Bear Trap by +50 %.

Trapper.name: Tar Bottle
Trapper.description:
A black, matte and sticky substance that when applied to Bear Traps, makes them far less noticeable.
Darkens the Bear Trap.

Trapper.name: Trapper Bag
Trapper.description:
A cured leather waist bag.Large and sturdy to transport hunting equipment.
Increases the number of carried Bear Traps by +1.

Trapper.name: Honing Stone
Trapper.description:
When used with the Bear Trap, the stone sharpens its blades.
The razor-sharp blades inflict deep wounds aimed at bleeding the victim as fast as possible.
Survivors caught in a Bear Trap,  who free themselves, are inflicted with the Dying State.

Trapper.name: Oily Coil
Trapper.description:
A clear oil that makes handling the Bear Trap's spring more hazardous.
Resetting a Bear Trap reveals the Aura of the last Survivor to have disarmed it for 5 seconds.

Trapper.name: Tension Spring
Trapper.description:
A high tension spring that snaps back into place after being stretched.
Automatically resets the Bear Trap 2 seconds after a Survivor escaped from it.

Trapper.name: Trapper Sack
Trapper.description:
A crude leather sack suitable for foraging.
Causes all Bear Traps to be carried in your inventory at the beginning of the Trial.
You can no longer pick up any placed Bear Traps, only reset them.

Trapper.name: Bloody Coil
Trapper.description:
Part sticky, part slippery, this grim liquid makes handling the Bear Traps spring more dangerous.
When a healthy Survivor disarms a Bear Trap, the Bloody Coil exacts its price, putting the Survivor into the Injured State.

Trapper.name: Iridescent Stone
Trapper.description:
Bear Traps sharpened with the sickly gleaming stone seem to gain a life of their own.
Automatically resets and arms a random disarmed Bear Trap every 30 seconds.

Wraith.name: "The Beast" - Soot
Wraith.description:
The Kunwulju symbol, representing the Realm of Fear, is finger-drawn out of soot on the body of the Bell.
Your Terror Radius is no longer suppressed when Cloaked.
Grants +100 % bonus Bloodpoints for Stalking and Surprise Attack Score Events.

Wraith.name: "The Ghost" - Soot
Wraith.description:
The Khugwemuu symbol, representing the Spirit World, is finger-drawn out of soot on the body of the Bell.
Your Terror Radius and Red Stain are suppressed for another 6 seconds after uncloaking.

Wraith.name: "The Hound" - Soot
Wraith.description:
The Wonnug symbol, representing a peerless tracker, is finger-drawn out of soot on the body of the Bell.
When Cloaked, Pools of Blood appear to you in bright red.

Wraith.name: "The Serpent" - Soot
Wraith.description:
The Laokeye symbol, representing cunning, is finger-drawn out of soot on the body of the Bell.
Breaking Breakable Walls or Pallets by any means, or performing the Damage Generator action on incomplete Generators, will cause you to automatically uncloak.

Wraith.name: "Blind Warrior" - Mud
Wraith.description:
The Baikra-Kaeug symbol, representing ferocity, is finger-drawn in mud on the body of the Bell.
Survivors hit with a Surprise Attack suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 60 seconds.

Wraith.name: "Blink" - Mud
Wraith.description:
The Kratin symbol, representing quick passing, is finger-drawn in mud on the body of the Bell.
Reduces the Cloaking time by -40 %.

Wraith.name: "Swift Hunt" - Mud
Wraith.description:
The Kuntin-Takkho symbol, representing a rapid descent on a prey, is finger-drawn in mud on the body of the Bell.
Reduces the Uncloaking time by -8 %.

Wraith.name: "Windstorm" - Mud
Wraith.description:
The Ohuwe-Onmnea symbol, representing a howling storm, is finger-drawn in mud on the body of the Bell.
Increases your Movement Speed by +5 % when Cloaked.

Wraith.name: Bone Clapper
Wraith.description:
A Bell clapper made from a highly polished piece of bone.Causes the sounds of the Wailing Bell to echo and warp chaotically.
Survivors are unable to discern the distance and direction of the Wailing Bell.

Wraith.name: "Blind Warrior" - White
Wraith.description:
The Baikra-Kaeug symbol, representing ferocity, is stamped in white ink on the body of the Bell.
Survivors hit with a Surprise Attack suffer from the Haemorrhage and Mangled Status Effects for 70 seconds.

Wraith.name: "Blink" - White
Wraith.description:
The Kratin symbol, representing quick passing, is stamped in white ink on the body of the Bell.
Reduces the Cloaking time by -60 %.

Wraith.name: "Shadow Dance" - White
Wraith.description:
The Yiwarick symbol, representing dark synergy, is stamped in white ink on the body of the Bell.
Increases the Action speeds for breaking Breakable Walls and Pallets, damaging Generators, and vaulting Windows by +40 % while Cloaked.

Wraith.name: "Swift Hunt" - White
Wraith.description:
The Kuntin-Takkho symbol, representing a rapid descent on a prey, is stamped in white ink on the body of the Bell.
Reduces the Uncloaking time by -10 %.

Wraith.name: "Windstorm" - White
Wraith.description:
The Ohuwe-Onmnea symbol, representing a howling storm, is stamped in white ink on the body of the Bell.
Increases your Movement Speed by +7 % when Cloaked.

Wraith.name: "All Seeing" - Blood
Wraith.description:
The Kra-Frabai symbol, representing the Entity watching over us, is stamped in blood on the head of the Bell.
Unlocks hidden potential in your Aura-reading ability:
The Auras of Survivors are revealed to you within 8 metres of your location when Cloaked.

Wraith.name: "Shadow Dance" - Blood
Wraith.description:
The Yiwarick symbol, representing dark synergy, is stamped in blood on the body of the Bell.
Increases the Action speeds for breaking Breakable Walls and Pallets, damaging Generators, and vaulting Windows by +60 % when Cloaked.

Wraith.name: "Swift Hunt" - Blood
Wraith.description:
The Kuntin-Takkho symbol, representing a rapid descent on a prey, is stamped in blood on the body of the Bell.
Reduces the Uncloaking time by -12 %.

Wraith.name: "Windstorm" - Blood
Wraith.description:
The Ohuwe-Onmnea symbol, representing a howling storm, is stamped in blood on the body of the Bell.
Increases your Movement Speed by +9 % when Cloaked.

Wraith.name: "All Seeing" - Spirit
Wraith.description:
The Kra-Frabai symbol, representing the Entity watching over us, ominously glows on the head of the Bell.
Unlocks hidden potential in your Aura-reading ability:
Reveals the Repair progression of Generators via the intensity of their Aura when Cloaked.

Wraith.name: Coxcombed Clapper
Wraith.description:
A simple coxcomb knotted rope wrapped around the bell clapper to muffle its sound.A malevolent Aura emanates from it.
Silences the Wailing Bell.

Hillbilly.name: Counterweight
Hillbilly.description:
Adds weight to the base, for stability.
Reduces the initial Turn rate of the Chainsaw during a Chainsaw Sprint by -70 %.

Hillbilly.name: Cracked Primer Bulb
Hillbilly.description:
A button that clears air from the fuel lines.This machine needs to be fed.
Increases the Charge rate of the Overdrive Meter by +15 %.
Survivors hit with the Chainsaw are only damaged for a single Health State.

Hillbilly.name: Dad's Boots
Hillbilly.description:
A pair of trusty boots, pulled from the corpse of Max Thompson Senior.
Increases the Turn speed during a Chainsaw Sprint by +30 %.

Hillbilly.name: Steel Toe Boots
Hillbilly.description:
Boots with a reinforced toe that offer protection from impact.
Reduces the Cool-down time after hitting an obstacle during a Chainsaw Sprint by -10 %.

Hillbilly.name: Clogged Intake
Hillbilly.description:
Modifying the airflow is key to modifying the Chainsaw's power.
Extends the duration of Overdrive by +15 %.

Hillbilly.name: Greased Throttle
Hillbilly.description:
A lubricated trigger.One twitch of the finger brings the Chainsaw back to life.
Reduces the Cool-down time after using the Chainsaw by -5 %, when not in Overdrive.

Hillbilly.name: Off-Brand Motor Oil
Hillbilly.description:
Affordable oil that can be used to lubricate noisy chains.
Increases the Charge rate of the Overdrive Meter by +15 %.

Hillbilly.name: Spiked Boots
Hillbilly.description:
Boots with strapped-on pieces of metal which burrow into mud for more stability and control with each step.
Increases the Turn speed during the Chainsaw Sprint by +45 %.

Hillbilly.name: Thermal Casing
Hillbilly.description:
A thicker case that allows the user to control the conservation of energy.
Reduces the Dissipation speed of the Overdrive Meter when not using the Chainsaw by -20 %.

Hillbilly.name: Begrimed Chains
Hillbilly.description:
A foul yet oddly familiar chain, coated with something unpleasant.
Survivors hit with the Chainsaw suffer from the Haemorrhage and Mangled Status Effects for 70 seconds.

Hillbilly.name: Discarded Air Filter
Hillbilly.description:
A cracked and dusty filter.It still manages to work better than the stock model.
Increases the Decay delay for the Overdrive Meter by +20 %.

Hillbilly.name: Low Kickback Chains
Hillbilly.description:
A specialised chain that reduces the likelihood of kickback.
Reduces the Cool-down time after hitting an obstacle during a Chainsaw Sprint by -15 %.

Hillbilly.name: Ragged Engine
Hillbilly.description:
Some would say it needs a tune-up.Max would say it is tuned-up.
Reduces the Dissipation speed of the Overdrive Meter when not using the Chainsaw by -30 %.

Hillbilly.name: The Thompsons' Mix
Hillbilly.description:
A special oily substance used in the lubrication of all machinery concocted by the Thompsons themselves.
Reduces the Cool-down time after using the Chainsaw by -10 %, when not in Overdrive.

Hillbilly.name: Apex Muffler
Hillbilly.description:
A masterfully crafted chainsaw muffler that outperforms all others.
Silences the Chainsaw for all Survivors outside of the Terror Radius.

Hillbilly.name: Filthy Slippers
Hillbilly.description:
Max sometimes struggled to hear his mother's footfalls.
Gain the Undetectable Status Effect until you stop sprinting after maintaining a Chainsaw Sprint for at least 2 seconds.

Hillbilly.name: High-Speed Idler Screw
Hillbilly.description:
A loosened screw will bring more power to the Chainsaw
Increases the Decay delay for the Overdrive Meter by +30 %.

Hillbilly.name: LoPro Chains
Hillbilly.description:
Light chains that decrease the weight of the Chainsaw, allowing for greater manoeuvrability.
Allows you to continue the Chainsaw Sprint after breaking a Pallet or Breakable Wall with the Chainsaw.
Survivors hit with the Chainsaw within 5 seconds of breaking a Pallet or a Breakable Wall are only damaged for a single Health State.

Hillbilly.name: Iridescent Engravings
Hillbilly.description:
Engravings found on the Chainsaw body representing the dark beast that lives in The Fog.Fills the user with determination.
Increases your Movement speed during a Chainsaw Sprint by +20 %.
Increases the Charge time of the Chainsaw by +12 %.

Hillbilly.name: Tuned Carburettor
Hillbilly.description:
Despite being caked in dirt and oil, this carburettor has been well adjusted.
Increases the Charge speed of the Chainsaw by +20 %.
Reduces your Movement speed to 4.4 m/s.

Nurse.name: Metal Spoon
Nurse.description:
A dull, partially rusted and stained metallic spoon.Confiscated from Room 202's patient, the "Bad Man".
Survivors hit by a Special Attack have the volume of their Grunts of Pain increased by +50 % for the next 60 seconds.

Nurse.name: Plaid Flannel
Nurse.description:
A torn piece of red and black plaid flannel.The scrap of fabric imbues The Nurse with devastating focus.
Unlocks the ability to see the Landing zone of the Blink.

Nurse.name: White Nit Comb
Nurse.description:
A parasitic nit comb taken from the clinic.Once the symbol of a deep connection between an anxious patient and her nurse.
Grants +100 % bonus Bloodpoints for Blink Attack Score Events.
Reduces the Lunge duration of Special Attacks by -0.15 seconds, which reduces your Attack range by -50 %.

Nurse.name: Wooden Horse
Nurse.description:
An unpainted toy carved out of cheap wood to resemble a horse.Once the symbol of a deep connection between a catatonic patient and his nurse.
Reduces the additional Fatigue applied by missed Special Attacks by -0.5 seconds.

Nurse.name: Bad Man Keepsake
Nurse.description:
A rotten molar ripped from the "Cataontic Boy's" cold dead hand.Normally stable and calm, it becomes incredibly agitated at The Nurse's touch.
Survivors hit with a Special Attack have their Auras revealed to you, if they are healing or being healed within 28 metres of your location for 60 seconds.

Nurse.name: Catatonic Boy's Treasure
Nurse.description:
A pine-cone which unexpectedly calmed a patient's repetitive movement.Taken from the "Catatonic Boy's" body.
Reduces the additional Fatigue applied by Chain Blinks by -65 %.

Nurse.name: Dark Cincture
Nurse.description:
A black rope used as a belt in times of mourning.Taken from Father Campbell's body.
Increases your Movement speed during the Chain Blink Window by +30 %.

Nurse.name: Dull Bracelet
Nurse.description:
A worthless piece of jewellery that might have an important significance to someone.Taken from the "Anxious Girl's" body.
Grants +100 % bonus Bloodpoints for Precise Blink Score Events.
Reduces the maximum range of the Blink by -20 %.

Nurse.name: Pocket Watch
Nurse.description:
A charred and broken pocket watch with rattling pieces.Taken from Nurse Moris' body.
Increases the duration of the Chain Blink Window by +0.2 seconds.

Nurse.name: Anxious Gasp
Nurse.description:
The gasp of surprise collected from the asylum patient Mary Jenner, also known as the "Anxious Girl" that The Nurse was fond of.Twitches vigorously at The Nurse's touch.
Coming within 1 metre of Survivors while teleporting causes them to scream and reveal their location.
Grants 200 Bloodpoints in the Deviousness Category.

Nurse.name: Ataxic Respiration
Nurse.description:
The irregular and deteriorating breath collected from the asylum patient known as the "Catatonic Boy".Normally stable and calm, it becomes incredibly agitated at The Nurse's touch.
Reduces the duration of Fatigue by -7 %.

Nurse.name: Fragile Wheeze
Nurse.description:
The whistling and rattling breath stolen from Father Campbell.Silently curves and bends at The Nurse's touch.
Survivors hit with a Special Attack suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Nurse.name: Heavy Panting
Nurse.description:
The slow and bulging breath stolen from Harvey Kavanagh, the asylum's "Fat Orderly".Dimly oscillates at The Nurse's touch.
Extends the Lunge duration of Special Attacks to 130 %, which increases your Attack range by +30 %.
This effect only applies after the second or third Blink.

Nurse.name: Spasmodic Breath
Nurse.description:
The twitchy and tremulous breath stolen from the "Bad Man".Aggressively pulses and jumps at The Nurse's touch.
Hitting a Survivor with a Special Attack causes the following effects for 60 seconds:
Increases your Movement speed to 4.6 m/s.
Disables your Power.

Nurse.name: "Bad Man's" Last Breath
Nurse.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from the asylum patient known as the "Bad Man".In the hands of The Nurse, it jolts with intensity.
Hitting Survivors with a Special Attack grants the Undetectable Status Effect for 25 seconds.
"Bad Man's" Last Breath" has a cool-down of 45 seconds.

Nurse.name: Campbell's Last Breath
Nurse.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from the asylum priest Father Campbell.In the hand of The Nurse, it crackles with intensity.
Reappearing from a fully charged Blink, you automatically Blink at full charge in the direction you are facing.
This requires that you have at least 1 Charge left after the initial Blink.

Nurse.name: Jenner's Last Breath
Nurse.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from the asylum patient Mary Jenner, also known as the "Anxious Girl".In the hands of The Nurse, it trembles with intensity.
After exhausting all of your Blinks, but before succumbing to Fatigue, press the Active Ability button to immediately Blink back to your starting location.
Recharges your Power by +1 Charge.

Nurse.name: Kavanagh's Last Breath
Nurse.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from the asylum orderly Harvey Kavanagh, also known as the "Fat Orderly".In the hands of The Nurse, it wobbles with intensity.
When succumbing to Fatigue, all Survivors within 8 metres of your location suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 60 seconds.

Nurse.name: Matchbox
Nurse.description:
A matchbox containing an odd collection of mismatched buttons.Serves as a reminder of a horrible place.
Increases your Movement speed to 4.4 m/s for the entire Trial.
Restricts your Power to just 1 Blink.
This cannot be altered by other Add-ons.

Nurse.name: Torn Bookmark
Nurse.description:
A white and pristine piece of ribbon once attached to a sacred book.Serves as the symbol of a dispute.
Increases the number of available Power Tokens by +1.
Extends the Power Recharge duration to 130 %.

Shape.name: Blond Hair
Shape.description:
A single slightly wavy blond hair.
Increases the duration of Evil Within III by +10 seconds.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 150 %.

Shape.name: Boyfriend's Memo
Shape.description:
A "romantic", if slightly sleazy, note left around to draw the attention of a female lover.
Increases the reach of Lunge Attacks while in Evil Within I by +50 %.
"The note is signed: D."

Shape.name: Memorial Flower
Shape.description:
A partially faded and dried pink larkspur picked up from a gravestone.
Increases your Stalk rate by +11 %.

Shape.name: Tacky Earrings
Shape.description:
A very cheap piece of jewellery made from plastic. Painted to resemble precious material.
Increases your Movement speed by +10 % while Stalking.

Shape.name: Dead Rabbit
Shape.description:
A grey rabbit which has been opened from neck to tail.
Reduces your Terror Radius by -25 % while in Evil Within II.
Increases your Terror Radius by +25 % while in Evil Within III.

Shape.name: Glass Fragment
Shape.description:
A tiny piece of tinted glass, probably from a broken object.It is impossible to determine its origin.
The Auras of Survivors are revealed to you for 3 seconds after stalking them for at least 1 second while in Evil Within I.

Shape.name: Hair Brush
Shape.description:
A nylon bristle brush used to add body and softness to hair.
Increases the duration of Evil Within III by +20 seconds.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 150 %.

Shape.name: Jewellery
Shape.description:
A large necklace made of beads an inexpensive metals.One of Judith's favourites.
Increases your Movement speed by +20 % while Stalking.

Shape.name: Reflective Fragment
Shape.description:
A tiny piece of a highly reflective material most probably from a broken mirror.
The Auras of Survivors are revealed to you for 2 seconds after stalking them for at least 1 second while in Evil Within II.

Shape.name: Hair Bow
Shape.description:
A blue tartan ribbon used to tie hair.
Increases the duration of Evil Within III by +30 seconds.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 150 %.

Shape.name: J. Myers Memorial
Shape.description:
A glossy page ripped from the 1965 Haddonfield High School yearbook, one dedicated to the memory of Judith Myers.
Increases your Stalk rate by +25 %.

Shape.name: Jewellery Box
Shape.description:
A barren wooden box in which vanity items were once stored.
Increases your Movement speed by +30 % while Stalking.

Shape.name: Judith's Journal
Shape.description:
A journal identified as owned by Judith M. Myers.Most of the pages are defaced with frightening and disturbing drawings.
Increases your Stalk rate on your Obsession by +40 %.

Shape.name: Mirror Shard
Shape.description:
A large and sharp piece of a broken mirror.
The Auras of Survivors are revealed to you for 5 seconds after stalking them for at least 1 second while in Evil Within II.

Shape.name: Lock of Hair
Shape.description:
A cut lock of blond hair bunched with a black elastic.
Increases the duration of Evil Within III by +40 seconds.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 200 %.

Shape.name: Scratched Mirror
Shape.description:
A standing portable vanity mirror which has been violently scratched with a sharp metallic object.
The Auras of all Survivors within 32 metres of your location are revealed to you while Stalking.
Evil Within can no longer progress past Tier I.
Grants +200 % bonus Bloodpoints in the Deviousness Category for Hit Score Events on top of the regular Bloodpoints granted in the Brutality Category.

Shape.name: Tombstone Piece
Shape.description:
A fist-sized granite piece taken from a broken tombstone.
Grants the ability to kill healthy and injured Survivors by your own hands while in Evil Within III.
Killing a Survivor drains the Power Gauge by -200 %, but not past Evil Within II.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 250 %.

Shape.name: Vanity Mirror
Shape.description:
A standing portable vanity mirror in perfect condition except for a fine layer of dust and face powder covering it.
The Auras of all Survivors within 16 metres of your location are revealed to you while Stalking.
Evil Within can no longer progress past Tier II.
Grants +150 % bonus Bloodpoints in the Deviousness Category for Hit Score Events on top of the regular Bloodpoints granted in the Brutality Category.

Shape.name: Fragrant Tuft of Hair
Shape.description:
A tuft of blond hair which was forcefully torn off someone's scalp.Releases hints of feminine floral fragrance.
Grants unlimited duration to Evil Within III.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 300 %.

Shape.name: Judith's Tombstone
Shape.description:
A large and heavy granite tombstone stolen from Mt. Sinclair cemetery, belonging to Judith Myers.
Grants the ability to kill healthy and injured Survivors by your own hands while in Evil Within III.
Increases the threshold to reach Evil Within III for the first time to 300 %.
Reduces your Movement speed by -9 % while in Evil Within III.
"Here lies our beloved daughter."

Hag.name: Bog Water
Hag.description:
Murky water contained in a glass pill bottle from another time.
Reduces the Trigger range of Phantasm Traps by -10 %.

Hag.name: Dead Fly Mud
Hag.description:
A small lump of mud, black with the remains of flies.Devoured to increase stamina.
Increases the Teleport range to tripped Phantasm Traps by +10 %.

Hag.name: Powdered Eggshell
Hag.description:
Minuscule eggshell fragments shimmering with a pale golden hue.
Increases the Tripped duration of Phantasm Traps by +20 %.

Hag.name: Rope Necklet
Hag.description:
A rigid ornament worn around the neck made from dead plants.
Increases the Setting speed of Phantasm Traps by +10 %.

Hag.name: Bloodied Water
Hag.description:
Tainted water contained in a folded water lily leaf.
Reduces the Trigger range of Phantasm Traps by -20 %.

Hag.name: Cypress Necklet
Hag.description:
A rigid ornament worn around the neck made from dead plants adorned with crudely attached cypress bark and swamp moss.
Increases the Setting speed of Phantasm Traps by +15 %.

Hag.name: Dragonfly Wings
Hag.description:
A handful of yellowish wings, dry and crisp.Devoured to increase stamina.
Increases the Teleport range to tripped Phantasm Traps by +12.5 %.

Hag.name: Half Eggshell
Hag.description:
One half of a perfectly round hollow eggshell.
Increases the Tripped duration of Phantasm Traps by +25 %.

Hag.name: Pussy Willow Catkins
Hag.description:
A handful of small, pristine flower clusters covered in a fine greyish fur.
The Auras of Survivors tripping Phantasm Traps are revealed to you for 3 seconds.

Hag.name: Bloodied Mud
Hag.description:
A handful of mud with veins of deep crimson.
The bloody layers empower the mud.
Reduces the Trigger range of Phantasm Traps by -30 %.

Hag.name: Cracked Turtle Egg
Hag.description:
A pale orange turtle egg, cracked and emptied of its content.
Increases the Tripped duration of Phantasm Traps by +30 %.

Hag.name: Dried Cicada
Hag.description:
A large swamp cicada covered in a fine layer of ash; crispy.Devoured to increase stamina.
Increases the Teleport range to tripped Phantasm Traps by +15 %.

Hag.name: Swamp Orchid Necklet
Hag.description:
A rigid ornament worn around the neck made from dead plants adorned with withered orchid petals and leaves.
Increases the Setting speed of Phantasm Traps by +20 %.

Hag.name: Willow Wreath
Hag.description:
Three frail willow branches attached to form a triangular wreath.
The Auras of Survivors tripping Phantasm Traps are revealed to you for 5 seconds.

Hag.name: Disfigured Ear
Hag.description:
The cannibal village deaf boy's ear.Deformed due to several hits to the head.The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power:
Survivors suffer from the Deafened Status Effect for 6 seconds after triggering a Phantasm Trap.

Hag.name: Grandma's Heart
Hag.description:
The cold heart of the cannibal village elder.The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.
Whenever Survivors trigger Phantasm Traps, you benefit from the following effects for their tripped duration:
Suppresses your Terror Radius.
Doubles the range of the Fake Terror Radius emitted by the Mud Phantasms to 16 metres.
"Bring me another slice of the girl." — Grandma

Hag.name: Rusty Shackles
Hag.description:
Shackles once used to hold prisoners and carcasses in the cannibal village cellar.The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.
Suppresses any indication to Survivors that they tripped Phantasm Traps.
Suppresses the creation of Mud Phantasms.

Hag.name: Scarred Hand
Hag.description:
The cut up, severed hand of the cannibal village butcher.The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.
Grants collision with Survivors to both Phantasm Traps and the Mud Phantasms.
Grants +300 % bonus Bloodpoints in the Deviousness Category.
Disables your ability to teleport to tripped Phantasm Traps.
Scarred Hand trumps all other Add-ons.

"..." — The Butcher

Hag.name: Mint Rag
Hag.description:
A small piece of cotton torn from the dress worn by Lisa Sherwood on the day she disappeared.The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.
Press the Active Ability button to teleport to any untripped Phantasm Trap anywhere in the environment.
Mint Rag has a cool-down of 10 seconds.

Hag.name: Waterlogged Shoe
Hag.description:
A child's shoe, long lost in the bog's waters.The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.
Increases your default Movement speed by +7.5 % to 4.73 m/s.
Survivors suffer from a -9 % Hindered Status Effect within the Trigger range of Phantasm Traps.
Disables your ability to teleport to tripped Phantasm Traps.

Doctor.name: "Calm" - Class I
Doctor.description:
An ECT procedure using a deep wavelength that soothes various mental illnesses.With Carter's Spark as its source, this procedure can cause mild anxiety in the patient.
Increases your Terror Radius by +4 metres while Static Blast is ready to be used.
Reduces your Terror Radius by -4 metres while Static Blast is on cool-down.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Calm:

Madness II: Survivors intermittently hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.
Madness III: Survivors constantly hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.

Doctor.name: "Order" - Class I
Doctor.description:
A conventional ECT procedure, part of a patient's daily routine at the Léry's Memorial Institute.Can cause a state of mild confusion in the patient.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of Static Blast by -2 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Order:

Broken Pallets are randomly replaced by dropped or upright Illusionary Pallets, which persist until approached by Survivors.
New Illusionary Pallets are generated every 20 seconds.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Pallets.

Doctor.name: Maple Knight
Doctor.description:
A white knight chess piece made of maple.This gift from an old man brings back distant memories and imbues The Doctor with devastating focus.
Grants the ability to see the Area of Effect of the Shock Therapy Attack.

Doctor.name: Mouldy Electrode
Doctor.description:
A mouldy electrode which can nevertheless conduct a weak electrical current.
Extends the Area of Effect of the Shock Therapy Attack by +2 metres.

Doctor.name: "Calm" - Class II
Doctor.description:
A risky ECT procedure using a deep wavelength that soothes various mental illnesses.With Carter's Spark as its source, this procedure can cause moderate anxiety in the patient.
Increases your Terror Radius by +6 metres while Static Blast is ready to be used.
Reduces your Terror Radius by -6 metres while Static Blast is on cool-down.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Calm:

Madness II: Survivors intermittently hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.
Madness III: Survivors constantly hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.

Doctor.name: "Discipline" - Class II
Doctor.description:
Project Awakening ECT procedure for disciplinary action which uses a fixed dose at high voltage.Can cause a state of moderate paranoia in the patient.
Reduces the Detonation delay of the Shock Therapy Attack by -0.1 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Discipline:

Madness II: During a Chase, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
This effect lingers for 6 seconds after the Chase ends.
Madness III: In any situation, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Red Stain.

"We re-educate our patients with the greatest care." — Léry's Memorial Institute

Doctor.name: "Order" - Class II
Doctor.description:
A high stimulus ECT procedure, part of a patient's daily routine at the Léry's Memorial Institute.Can cause a state of moderate confusion in the patient.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of Static Blast by -4 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Order:

Broken Pallets are randomly replaced by dropped or upright Illusionary Pallets, which persist until approached by Survivors.
New Illusionary Pallets are generated every 20 seconds.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Pallets.

"Side effects are very rare." — Léry's Memorial Institute

Doctor.name: "Restraint" - Class II
Doctor.description:
An experimental ECT procedure developed within The Fog.Uses a wavelength that links the patient's and The Doctor's minds.This procedure is known to cause mild cases of hallucination in the patient.
The Auras of Survivors who have their Madness increased by one Tier are revealed to you for 1 second.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Restraint:

Increases the duration of Illusionary Doctors by +6 seconds.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Doctors.

Doctor.name: Polished Electrode
Doctor.description:
A like-new standard electrode equipment to conduct electro-convulsive treatments.
Extends the Area of Effect of the Shock Therapy Attack by +3 metres.

Doctor.name: "Discipline" - Class III
Doctor.description:
Project Awakening ECT procedure for disciplinary action which uses a fixed dose at very high voltage.Can cause a state of serious paranoia in the patient.
Reduces the Detonation delay of the Shock Therapy Attack by -0.15 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Discipline:

Madness II: During a Chase, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
This effect lingers for 6 seconds after the Chase ends.
Madness III: In any situation, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Red Stain.

"Respect of our patients is at the core of our principles." — Léry's Memorial Institute

Doctor.name: "Restraint" - Class III
Doctor.description:
An experimental ECT procedure developed within The Fog.Uses a high stimulus wavelength to link the patient's and The Doctor's minds.This procedure is known to cause serious cases of hallucinations in the patient.
The Auras of Survivors who have their Madness increased by one Tier are revealed to you for 2 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Restraint:

Increases the duration of Illusionary Doctors by +6 seconds.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Doctors.

Doctor.name: High Stimulus Electrode
Doctor.description:
An experimental electrode that can withstand very high charges for a longer period of time.
Extends the Area of Effect of the Shock Therapy Attack by +4 metres.

Doctor.name: Interview Tape
Doctor.description:
A compact cassette from Project Awakening containing an unedited interview of a victim.Opens The Doctor's mind to alternate treatment methods.
Reshapes the Area of Effect of the Shock Therapy Attack from a cone into a narrow beam that is 2 metres wide and 24 metres long.

Doctor.name: Scrapped Tape
Doctor.description:
A compact cassette from Project Awakening containing mostly white noise.Opens The Doctor's mind to alternate treatment methods.
Reshapes the Area of Effect of the Shock Therapy Attack from a cone into a hollow ring which is placed 8 metres in front of you, and has an outer radius of 4.2 metres and an inner radius of 3 metres.

Doctor.name: "Calm" - Carter's Notes
Doctor.description:
An experimental version of the ECT procedure annotated by Doctor Herman Carter himself.Uses a deep wavelength that soothes various mental illnesses.With Carter's Spark as its source, this procedure causes uncontrollable fear and anxiety in the patient.
Increases your Terror Radius by +8 metres while Static Blast is ready to be used.
Reduces your Terror Radius by -8 metres while Static Blast is on cool-down.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Calm:

Madness II: Survivors intermittently hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.
Madness III: Survivors constantly hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.
"Higher quality seizures trigger catatonia. At least it gives me peace for the time it lasts." — Herman Carter

Doctor.name: "Discipline" - Carter's Notes
Doctor.description:
Project Awakening ECT procedure for disciplinary action, annotated by Doctor Herman Carter himself.The intolerably high voltage leaves the patient in a severe state of paranoia.
Reduces the Detonation delay of the Shock Therapy Attack by -0.2 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Discipline:

Madness II: During a Chase, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
This effect lingers for 6 seconds after the Chase ends.
Madness III: In any situation, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Red Stain.

"To avoid relapse from our most tenacious subjects, use maximum levels when proceeding with disciplinary actions." — Herman Carter

Doctor.name: "Order" - Carter's Notes
Doctor.description:
An experimental version of the ECT procedure, annotated by Doctor Herman Carter himself.The long, constant stimulus leaves the patient in a state of severe confusion.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of Static Blast by -6 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Order:

Broken Pallets are randomly replaced by dropped or upright Illusionary Pallets, which persist until approached by Survivors.
New Illusionary Pallets are generated every 20 seconds.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Pallets.

"The stimulus must be kept active at a convulsive level." — Herman Carter

Doctor.name: "Restraint" - Carter's Notes
Doctor.description:
An experimental ECT procedure developed within The Fog, crudely annotated.Uses an unbearable stimulus wavelength to link the patient's and The Doctor's minds.This procedure is known to cause severe cases of hallucinations in the patient.
The Auras of Survivors who have their Madness increased by one Tier are revealed to you for 3 seconds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer from the Affliction of Restraint:

Increases the duration of Illusionary Doctors by +6 seconds.
You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Doctors.

"I CAN SEE THEIR DISGUSTING ILLNESSES." — unsighned Notes, likely Herman Carter

Doctor.name: Iridescent King
Doctor.description:
A glass-like king chess piece moulded from The Fog itself.The Entity's trace reverberating within can break the most powerful minds.
Survivors affected by Madness suffer simultaneously from the Afflictions of Calm, Discipline, Order, and Restraint:
Survivors intermittently hear a distant Illusionary Terror Radius.
During a Chase, Survivors perceive an Illusionary Red Stain and Terror Radius, as if you were constantly right behind them.
Madness II: This effect lingers for 6 seconds after the Chase ends.
Madness III: This effect is constant, regardless of whether the Survivors are being chased or not.
Broken Pallets are randomly replaced by dropped or upright Illusionary Pallets, which persist until approached by Survivors.
New Illusionary Pallets are generated every 20 seconds.
Increases the duration of Illusionary Doctors by +6 seconds.

You share into your patients' Madness and can see the Illusionary Doctors, Red Stain, and Pallets.
"Gazing into the iridescent glass is plunging one's self into madness." — Herman Carter

Doctor.name: Iridescent Queen
Doctor.description:
A glass-like queen chess piece moulded from The Fog itself.It cannot be touched without receiving a considerable jolt of electricity.
Survivors struck by either the Shock Therapy Attack or a Static Blast acquire a lingering Static Charge, unless they are within 4 metres of another Survivor:
The Static Charge remains with the Survivor until it is discharged.
Charged Survivors who come within 4 metres of another Survivor trigger an automatic Shock Therapy Attack, shocking both Survivors and automatically discharging any remaining Static Charges.
"Once we have established an effective method of treatment, we can focus on its efficient means of delivery." — Herman Carter

Huntress.name: Amanita Toxin
Huntress.description:
A toxin from the Amanita mushroom, applied to the Hatchet's blade.It numbs the mind.
Survivors hit by Hatchets suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 60 seconds.

Huntress.name: Bandaged Haft
Huntress.description:
First-aid bandages securely rolled and attached to the Hatchet's haft.
Reduces the Cool-down duration between successive Hatchet throws by -10 %.

Huntress.name: Coarse Stone
Huntress.description:
This stone is too coarse to do any good.A blade damaged by it inflicts awful open wounds.
Increases the volume of Grunts of Pain of injured Survivors hit by Hatchets by +50 %.

Huntress.name: Yellowed Cloth
Huntress.description:
A simple scrap of material to tend to blisters and wipe the puss away.
Increases the Projectile speed of Hatchets by +10 %.

Huntress.name: Leather Loop
Huntress.description:
The right tool in the right hands is key to a successful hunt.
Successfully hitting a Survivor with a Hatchet grants a +2 % Haste Status Effect for 5 seconds.

Huntress.name: Manna Grass Braid
Huntress.description:
A circular decorative braid made from manna grass.This memory of a lost little one fills The Huntress with rage and focus.
Reduces the Wind-up time of Hatchets by -8 %.

Huntress.name: Oak Haft
Huntress.description:
A polished haft which allows for a quick and sly manipulation of the deadly tool.
Reduces the Cool-down duration between successive Hatchet throws by -20 %.

Huntress.name: Shiny Pin
Huntress.description:
A copper pin defaced beyond recognition yet polished to a high sheen.Pillaged from a particularly difficult prey.
Increases the Movement speed while winding Hatchets up by +5 %.

Huntress.name: Weighted Head
Huntress.description:
An oddly weighted Hatchet head, crafted to deliver a hard blow to its target.It requires a wielder with a strong arm.
Survivors hit by Hatchets suffer from the Incapacitated Status Effect for 10 seconds.

Huntress.name: Deerskin Gloves
Huntress.description:
Cured leather gloves that protect the hands and give a sure grip.
Reduces the Reload time at Lockers by -20 %.

Huntress.name: Flower Babushka
Huntress.description:
A clean and colourful handkerchief adorned with a flower pattern.This memory of a lost little one fills The Huntress with rage and focus.
Reduces the Wind-up time of Hatchets by -12 %.

Huntress.name: Rose Root
Huntress.description:
Dried petals that relieve symptoms of fatigue and overexertion when brewed in a tea.
Increases the Projectile speed of Hatchets by +20 %.

Huntress.name: Rusty Head
Huntress.description:
This Hatchet head is covered with crusty and volatile rust spots that make injuries particularly difficult to heal from.
Survivors hit by Hatchets suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Huntress.name: Venomous Concoction
Huntress.description:
A toxic concoction, applied to the Hatchet's blade.The murky concoction is mainly composed of Berus Snake venom, which gives it fatiguing capabilities.
Survivors hit by Hatchets suffer from the Exhausted Status Effect for 5 seconds.

Huntress.name: Begrimed Head
Huntress.description:
This Hatchet head is stained with a foul substance that afflicts anyone who it touches with debilities.
Survivors hit by Hatchets suffer from the Haemorrhage and Mangled Status Effects for 80 seconds.

Huntress.name: Glowing Concoction
Huntress.description:
An otherworldly concoction that faintly glows a foreboding light.
Survivors hit by Hatchets have their Aura revealed to you for 5 seconds.

Huntress.name: Infantry Belt
Huntress.description:
A sturdy utility belt pillaged from a soldier.He was quick in combat, but she was quicker.
Successfully hitting a Survivor with a Hatchet grants a +3 % Haste Status Effect for 5 seconds.

Huntress.name: Wooden Fox
Huntress.description:
Roughly carved, this fox statuette is no more than a few inches.A reminder that stealth and cunning is as effective as raw power.
Grants the Undetectable Status Effect after reloading at Lockers for 30 seconds.

Huntress.name: Iridescent Head
Huntress.description:
A glass-like Hatchet head moulded from The Fog itself.The blade is warm and reverberating with The Entity's power.
Survivors hit by Hatchets are automatically put into the Dying State.
Reduces the number of carried Hatchets to 1.
This number cannot be modified by other Add-ons.
"The iridescent glass cuts through flesh and soul."

Huntress.name: Soldier's Puttee
Huntress.description:
A wrap taken from a dead soldier.It provides protection and support to the ankle and lower leg.
Increases the Movement speed of The Huntress to 4.6 m/s while out of Hatchets.

Cannibal.name: Chainsaw File
Cannibal.description:
A file whose purpose is to hone Chainsaw chains.
Reduces the duration of a Tantrum by -0.5 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Spark Plug
Cannibal.description:
A clean spark plug fitted for a Chainsaw.
Reduces the Power Recharge time by -0.5 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Speed Limiter
Cannibal.description:
A mechanical device that limits the amount of fuel small engines can intake at one time, forcing a constant and safe speed.
Grants +100 % bonus Bloodpoints for Chainsaw Hit Score Events in the Deviousness Category.
Survivors hit with Bubba's Chainsaw are only damaged for a single Health State.

Cannibal.name: Vegetable Oil
Cannibal.description:
A rancid oil used as a poor quality lubricant.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of Bubba's Chainsaw by -0.3 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Chilli
Cannibal.description:
A big bowl of steaming Chilli to keep you fresh and strong.
Increases the duration of the Chainsaw Dash by +0.25 seconds per consumed Token.
Increases the duration of the Chainsaw Dash Window by +0.25 seconds.
"I got some good barbecue here!" — Drayton Sawyer

Cannibal.name: Homemade Muffler
Cannibal.description:
A makeshift exhaust system made of black gas pipes.
Reduces the duration of a Tantrum by -1 second.

Cannibal.name: Knife Scratches
Cannibal.description:
Scratches cover the Chainsaw's body, caused by a searing blade.Memories of reprimands fill its holder with the fear of failure.
Increases the Movement speed during a Chainsaw Dash by +2 %.
Increases the Power Charge time by +12 %.

Cannibal.name: Long Guide Bar
Cannibal.description:
A sturdy iron replacement bar for long chains.
Increases the threshold before Revving triggers a Tantrum by +2 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Primer Bulb
Cannibal.description:
Pumps more gas in the ignition system to ensure a quick and powerful start.
Reduces the Power Recharge time by -1 second.

Cannibal.name: Begrimed Chains
Cannibal.description:
This chain is stained with a foul substance that debilitates anyone it touches.
Causes Survivors hit by Bubba's Chainsaw to drop any carried Item.

Cannibal.name: Grisly Chains
Cannibal.description:
A chain with unusually hefty cutter teeth that leaves victims crippled even after being healed.
Survivors hit by Bubba's Chainsaw suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Shop Lubricant
Cannibal.description:
An oil specifically formulated for Chainsaws.A special additive prevents oil throw off.
The Auras of Survivors downed by Bubba's Chainsaw, if no other Survivors were within the Terror Radius, are hidden to other Survivors for 20 seconds.

Cannibal.name: The Beast's Marks
Cannibal.description:
Jagged marks cover the Chainsaw's body, punishment from the dark beast that lives in The Fog.Memories of violent reprimands fill its holder with the fear of failure.
Increases the Movement speed during a Chainsaw Dash by +3 %.
Increases the Power Charge time by +12 %.

Cannibal.name: The Grease
Cannibal.description:
A thick yellowish ooze, concocted by the Sawyers.Used for all-purpose lubrication around their house.
Increases the threshold before Revving triggers a Tantrum by +3 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Award-winning Chilli
Cannibal.description:
A big bowl of spicy Chilli made famous thanks to prime meat.
Increases the duration of the Chainsaw Dash by +0.5 seconds per consumed Token.
Increases the duration of the Chainsaw Dash Window by +0.5 seconds.
"The secret's in the meat" — Drayton Sawyer

Cannibal.name: Depth Gauge Rake
Cannibal.description:
A tool that increases the angle of the depth gauge, making the chain eat more "wood".
Increases the Power Tokens by +1.
Reduces the Power Charge speed by -18 %.
Reduces the Movement speed during a Chainsaw Dash by -2 %.

Cannibal.name: Light Chassis
Cannibal.description:
A light and durable Chainsaw chassis with a shorter guide bar.Makes the Chainsaw easier to handle.
The Auras of Survivors within 8 metres are revealed to you while revving Bubba's Chainsaw.

Cannibal.name: Rusted Chains
Cannibal.description:
This chain is covered with crusty and volatile rust spots that make injuries particularly difficult to heal.
Survivors hit by Bubba's Chainsaw suffer from the Broken Status Effect for 90 seconds.

Cannibal.name: Carburettor Tuning Guide
Cannibal.description:
A crudely drawn guide to properly adjust and tune a Chainsaw carburettor.
Automatically consumes all Tokens when starting a Chainsaw Dash, adding up their durations.
Increases the duration of the Chainsaw Dash by +0.5 seconds per consumed Token.
Reduces the Movement speed during a Chainsaw Dash by -2 %.
Reduces the Power Recharge rate by -0.28 c/s.

Cannibal.name: Iridescent Flesh
Cannibal.description:
A thin slice of smooth, young flesh.The veins shimmer with luminescent glow, as if life still flows within.
Instantly recharges all Power Tokens after hitting a Survivor with Bubba's Chainsaw.
Reduces the maximum duration of a Tantrum to 5 seconds.
"There are moments when we cannot believe that what is happening is really true.Pinch yourself and you may find out that it is." — Pam Jones

Nightmare.name: Garden Rake
Nightmare.description:
A small claw rake, a must have tool for any accomplished gardener.
Switches the type of Dream Traps used in the Trial:
Start the Trial with 7 Dream Pallets.

Nightmare.name: Kid's Drawing
Nightmare.description:
An unattributed drawing clearly crafted by a young child.
Grants 200 Bloodpoints in the Deviousness Category when a Survivor triggers a Dream Snare.
Reduces the Movement Speed penalty inflicted by Dream Snares by -10 %.

Nightmare.name: Sheep Block
Nightmare.description:
A white and blue wooden block depicting two woolly Lambs grazing and the letter "S".
Survivors interacting with a Dream Trap suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 60 seconds.

Nightmare.name: Wool Shirt
Nightmare.description:
A small boy's orange and yellow striped shirt. Identified with a sewn name tag to "Jesse".
Increases the Penalty for failing Repairing and Healing Skill Checks by -4 %.

Nightmare.name: Cat Block
Nightmare.description:
A white and purple wooden block depicting a sleeping Cat and the letter "C".
Using Dream Projection triggers Killer Instinct for 4 seconds on all Survivors within 16 metres of the Generator you teleported to.

Nightmare.name: Green Dress
Nightmare.description:
A little girl's green dress with a silky white ribbon.
Survivors inside the Dream World suffer from the following effects:
The Auras of Survivors failing Repairing or Healing Skill Checks are revealed to you for 3 seconds.
Increases the Penalty for failing those Skill Checks by -4 %.

Nightmare.name: Nancy's Sketch
Nightmare.description:
A crude and bold sketch made with Fusain, signed by Nancy H.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of Dream Projection by a stack-able -2 % for each asleep Survivor, up to a maximum of -8 %.

Nightmare.name: Outdoor Rope
Nightmare.description:
Sturdy outdoor rope, handy to tie up anything.
Survivors inside the Dream World suffer from the following effect:
Increases the audible range of their Repair noises by +8 metres.

Nightmare.name: Prototype Claws
Nightmare.description:
A home-made tool to facilitate bush trimming.
Switches the type of Dream Traps used in the Trial:
Start the Trial with 7 Dream Pallets.
The Auras of Survivors interacting with Dream Pallets are revealed to you for 4 seconds.

Nightmare.name: Blue Dress
Nightmare.description:
A little girl's pale blue dress with white lace which's front is ruined by large cuts.
Survivors inside the Dream World suffer from the following effects:
The Auras of Survivors failing Repairing or Healing Skill Checks are revealed to you for 4 seconds.
Increases the Penalty for failing those Skill Checks by -4 %.

Nightmare.name: Jump Rope
Nightmare.description:
A long Double-Dutch jump rope, stained with many years of use.
Survivors inside the Dream World suffer from the following effect:
Increases the volume of Grunts of Pain of injured Survivors by +50 %.

Nightmare.name: Nancy's Masterpiece
Nightmare.description:
A painting of a Character, made by Nancy Holbrook at Badham and kept as a treasure memory.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of Dream Projection by a stack-able -3 % for each asleep Survivor, up to a maximum of -12 %.

Nightmare.name: Paint Thinner
Nightmare.description:
A tin of a highly volatile and inflammable material.
Switches the type of Dream Traps used in the Trial:
Start the Trial with 7 Dream Pallets.
The Auras of Survivors interacting with Dream Pallets are revealed to you for 6 seconds.

Nightmare.name: Unicorn Block
Nightmare.description:
A white and red wooden block depicting a prancing Unicorn and the letter "U".
Survivors interacting with a Dream Trap suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 90 seconds.

Nightmare.name: "Z" Block
Nightmare.description:
A deeply scratched and burnt wooden block which's only recognisable feature is the letter "Z".
Using Dream Projection triggers Killer Instinct for 6 seconds on all Survivors within 16 metres of the Generator you teleported to.

Nightmare.name: Class Photo
Nightmare.description:
A large photograph taken at Badham Preschool showing the cheerful class of '94-95.
When channelling Dream Projection, the following effects apply:
All Generators spew blood.
Suppresses the appearance of the Husk.

You can no longer cancel Dream Projection.

Nightmare.name: Pill Bottle
Nightmare.description:
An empty pill bottle which once contained a medicine called Zoneral.
Reduces the threshold for intermittent Invisbility to a range of 12 to 24 metres.
Reduces the threshold for full Invisibility to a distance of 24 metres.
This effect also applies when carrying a Survivor.

Nightmare.name: Swing Chains
Nightmare.description:
Rusty, but sturdy chains used to securely attach a swing seat.
Survivors inside the Dream World suffer from the following effect:
Increases the volume of Footsteps of Survivors by +50 %.

Nightmare.name: Black Box
Nightmare.description:
A black cardboard box filled with photographs.
Survivors inside the Dream World suffer from the following effect:
Blocks opened Exit Gates for 15 seconds.

Nightmare.name: Red Paint Brush
Nightmare.description:
A large paint brush, wet with crimson paint.
All Survivors start the Trial asleep.
Survivors can no longer wake up by failing Skill Checks.

Pig.name: Combat Straps
Pig.description:
Leather straps that hold fabric in place for nimbler movement.
Increases the Transition speed into the Crouched State by +10 %.

Pig.name: Interlocking Razor
Pig.description:
A modification to the Reverse Bear Trap:The addition of interlocking razor blades makes it impossible to move suddenly in the Jigsaw Box without slitting one's wrists.
While injured, Survivors failing a Skill Check at a Jigsaw Box become afflicted by the Deep Wound Status Effect.

Pig.name: John's Medical File
Pig.description:
The medical file of a cancerous man.Fills the reader with dread and recklessness.
Increases your Movement speed by +10 % when Crouched.

Pig.name: Shattered Syringe
Pig.description:
Symbol of a broken way of life.Reminiscing about her past-self hardens her determination.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of missed Ambush Dash Attacks by -10 %.

Pig.name: Face Mask
Pig.description:
A modification to the Reverse Bear Trap:The heavy cloth face mask, laced with a sedative, partially suffocates the target, making it hard to concentrate.
Survivors caught in a Reverse Bear Trap suffer permanently from the Blindness Status Effect.

Pig.name: Last Will
Pig.description:
A latched wooden box with a satin lining, offered as part of a last will.
Increases your Movement speed during the Ambush Dash Attack by +6 %.
Increases the Charge time of the Ambush Dash Attack by +33 %.

Pig.name: Razor Wires
Pig.description:
A modification to the Reverse Bear Trap:The addition of razor sharp wires makes it extra difficult and potentially painful to search them.
While healthy, Survivors failing a Skill Check at a Jigsaw Box become injured.
Increases the Skill Check difficulty by +20 %.

Pig.name: Utility Blades
Pig.description:
A modification to the Reverse Bear Trap:Sharp blades attached to the Trap's interior lacerate the victim with every movement.
Survivors caught in a Reverse Bear Trap suffer from the Haemorrhage Status Effect whenever they are injured by any means.

Pig.name: Workshop Grease
Pig.description:
A simple tube of grease, used to lubricate the mechanisms of the hidden blade.
Reduces the Cool-down duration of missed Ambush Dash Attacks by -10 %.
Increases the Charge speed of the Ambush Dash Attack by +50 %.

Pig.name: Bag of Gears
Pig.description:
A few mechanical parts that allow the creation of challenging Jigsaw Boxes and easier to install Reverse Bear Traps.
Increases the Attachment speed of Reverse Bear Traps by +50 %.
Reduces the Search speed of Jigsaw Boxes by -14 %.

Pig.name: Jigsaw's Annotated Plan
Pig.description:
A disturbing, yet brilliant, trap design laid down on paper and annotated by Jigsaw.
Increases the number of carried Reverse Bear Traps by +1.
Increases the Death timer of Reverse Bear Traps by +10 seconds.
Reduces the Death timer of all Active Reverse Bear Traps by -10 seconds each time a Generator is completed.

Pig.name: Rules Set No.2
Pig.description:
Not all games need to have the same rules.
Disables the ability of Survivors to see the Auras of Jigsaw Boxes, until their Reverse Bear Trap becomes active.
"Listen, there are rules." — Jigsaw

Pig.name: Rusty Attachments
Pig.description:
A modification to the Reverse Bear Trap:Mouth spikes, covered with crusty and volatile rust spots that make injuries particularly difficult to heal.
Survivors caught in a Reverse Bear Trap suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Pig.name: Slow-Release Toxin
Pig.description:
A modification to the Reverse Bear Trap:A poison that is not fatal, but weakens the body and makes it nearly impossible to recover fully from any effort.
Survivors caught in a Reverse Bear Trap suffer permanently from the Exhausted Status Effect.

Pig.name: Amanda's Secret
Pig.description:
A black metal box containing a knife and various medical supplies, such as bandages and compresses.Deep cuts reduce stress and awaken the senses.
Survivors removing their Reverse Bear Trap trigger a Loud Noise Notification and have their Auras revealed to you for 6 seconds.

Pig.name: Crate of Gears
Pig.description:
This collection of mechanical parts allows the creation of extra-challenging Jigsaw Boxes and Reverse Bear Traps that are easier to install.
Increases the Attach speed of Reverse Bear Traps by +50 %.
Reduces the Search speed of Jigsaw Boxes by -25 %.

Pig.name: Jigsaw's Sketch
Pig.description:
A disturbing, yet brilliant, trap design sketched in detail on a sheet of paper.
Increases the number of carried Reverse Bear Traps by +1.
The Auras of Generators being repaired by Survivors wearing a Reverse Bear Traps are highlighted to you in yellow.

Pig.name: Tampered Timer
Pig.description:
A timer that has been fiddled with.A spring in the mechanism forces the gears to turn faster.
Reduces the Death timer of Reverse Bear Traps by -20 seconds.

Pig.name: Amanda's Letter
Pig.description:
A blackmailing Letter for the attention of Amanda.Fills the reader with rage and focus.
The Auras of Survivors within 16 metres are revealed to you when Crouched.
Reduces the number of carried Reverse Bear Traps by -2.
"Amanda, you were with Cecil the night Jill lost Gideon. You killed their child. You know it and I know it." — Detective Hoffman

Pig.name: Video Tape
Pig.description:
A recording of Jigsaw, explaining the game's rules to Amanda.Reminiscing about her past-self hardens her determination.
All Survivors start the Trial with a Reverse Bear Trap attached to them.

Clown.name: Fingerless Parade Gloves
Clown.description:
Part of the standard Clown apparel, the cut fingers allow for dexterous manipulations.
Increases the Throw speed of Bottles by +25 %.
Reduces the Throw angle of Bottles by -15 °.

Clown.name: Party Bottle
Clown.description:
Be the life of the party!
Bottles emit confetti when they break in addition to their usual effects.
Hitting Survivors directly with a Bottle grants 100 bonus Bloodpoints in the Deviousness Category.

Clown.name: Robin Feather
Clown.description:
A warm orange feather, soft to the touch.
Reduces the Cool-down duration between successive Bottle throws by -40 %.

Clown.name: VHS Porn
Clown.description:
An all time classic.You will not see things quite the same again.
Switches the colours of the Gas Clouds with one another.

Clown.name: Kerosene Can
Clown.description:
A thin and clear combustible liquid which numbs the mind when inhaled.
Survivors affected by Intoxication suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 30 seconds.

Clown.name: Solvent Jug
Clown.description:
A chemical volatile compound that irritates the respiratory tract, but increases absorption of the Afterpiece Antidote.
Increases the Invigoration duration by +1 second.

Clown.name: Starling Feather
Clown.description:
A black feather with an emerald gloss, very soft to the touch.
Reduces the Cool-down duration between successive Bottle throws by -50 %.

Clown.name: Sticky Soda Bottle
Clown.description:
It's sugary sweet, with only a little blood on the label.
Increases the strength of the Haste Status Effect from Invigoration by +2 % .

Clown.name: Thick Cork Stopper
Clown.description:
A sturdy cork fitting the Afterpiece Tonic Bottles marvellously.
Reduces the Reload time of the Bottles by -0.5 seconds.

Clown.name: Bottle of Chloroform
Clown.description:
A sweet-smelling organic compound with strong anaesthetic capabilities.
Increases the size and spread of the Intoxication Gas Clouds by +20 %.

Clown.name: Flask of Bleach
Clown.description:
A potent chemical which causes irritation, burns and lung damage.
Increases the strength of the Hindered Status Effect Survivors suffer from during Intoxication by an additional -4 %.

Clown.name: Smelly Inner Soles
Clown.description:
A mouldy inner sole which gives much comfort to tired feet.
Increases your Movement speed while reloading Bottles by +66 %.

Clown.name: Spirit of Hartshorn
Clown.description:
A pungent chemical compound consisting of ammonia.One whiff is enough to jolt even the most sluggish of minds.
Increases the size and spread of the Invigoration Gas Clouds by +20 %.

Clown.name: Sulphuric Acid Vial
Clown.description:
A thin and clear combustible liquid which numbs the mind when inhaled.
Survivors affected by Intoxication suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Clown.name: Cheap Gin Bottle
Clown.description:
When the night is rough and the day is rougher, a little hair of the dog will give you a boost.
Increases the strength of the Haste Status Effect from Invigoration by +3 % .

Clown.name: Cigar Box
Clown.description:
A grim and incomplete collection of fingers.Fills The Clown with longing and focuses his chemical crafting abilities.
The Auras of all other Players within 16 metres of their location are revealed to Invigorated Players for 6 seconds.

Clown.name: Ether 15 Vol%
Clown.description:
A highly volatile organic compound, toxic at this concentration.
Increases the Intoxication duration by +1 second.

Clown.name: Garish Make-Up Kit
Clown.description:
Some for the face and some for the Antidote.The unknown compound intensifies the Antidote's effect.
Increases the Invigoration duration by +2 seconds.

Clown.name: Redhead's Pinkie Finger
Clown.description:
The prized pinkie finger of a redhead.Faintly fragrant.Tastes of potpourri and varnish.
Survivors hit directly by Bottles suffer from the Exposed Status Effect for as long as they are affected by Intoxication.
Reduces the number of carried Bottles to 1.
This number cannot be modified by other Add-ons.

Clown.name: Tattoo's Middle Finger
Clown.description:
The prized middle finger of a large tattooed man.Has a faint taste of machinery oil.
The Auras of Survivors afflicted by either Intoxication or Invigoration are revealed to you for 6 seconds.

Spirit.name: Bear Oil
Spirit.description:
Melted animal fat that can lubricate the Bear Traps squeaky joints.
Setting a Bear Trap is silent.

Spirit.name: Makeshift Wrap
Spirit.description:
A scratched and worn brace made of thick, cured animal skin.
You are no longer caught in your own Bear Traps, they are automatically disarmed instead.

Spirit.name: Padded Jaws
Spirit.description:
These padded jaws are meant to restrain, not to wound.
Bear Traps immobilise Survivors without damaging them.
Grants 100 % bonus Bloodpoints for trapping Survivors.

Spirit.name: Trapper Gloves
Spirit.description:
Protective padded leather gloves.
Increases the Setting speed of the Bear Trap by +30 %.

Spirit.name: 4-Coil Spring Kit
Spirit.description:
A replacement kit for Bear Traps which changes the usual dual spring system to four coil springs, adding a great amount of strength to the Bear Traps hold.
Increases the Disarm time of the Bear Trap by +33 %.

Spirit.name: Coffee Grounds
Spirit.description:
An old rusted can containing damp coffee grounds.
Increases the strength of the Haste Status Effect after setting a Bear Trap by +5 % .

Spirit.name: Lengthened Jaws
Spirit.description:
Jaws with long teeth that dig further into the flesh than a conventional Bear Traps.
Survivors who escape from Bear Traps suffer from the Deep Wound Status Effect.

Spirit.name: Serrated Jaws
Spirit.description:
These replacement trap jaws have saw-like blades, causing awful open wounds when they snap.
Survivors injured by a Bear Trap suffer from the Haemorrhage Status Effect until fully healed.
"Like a predatory beast, it can smell and track blood."

Spirit.name: Wax Brick
Spirit.description:
A block of wax used to lower friction and facilitate movement in mechanical parts.
Increases the Rescue and Escape times of the Bear Trap by +33 %.

Spirit.name: Fastening Tools
Spirit.description:
A specialised set of tools used to fasten Bear Traps to ensure their effectiveness.
Increases the Rescue and Escape times from the Bear Trap by +25 %.
Increases the Setting speed of the Bear Trap by +50 %.

Spirit.name: Rusted Jaws
Spirit.description:
These Bear Trap jaws are covered with crusty and volatile rust spots, making injuries particularly difficult to heal.
Survivors injured by a Bear Trap suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 70 seconds.

Spirit.name: Secondary Coil
Spirit.description:
A secondary coil keeps the Bear Trap functional in times when the primary coil becomes unusable.
Increases the Disarm time of the Bear Trap by +50 %.

Spirit.name: Tar Bottle
Spirit.description:
A black, matte and sticky substance that when applied to Bear Traps, makes them far less noticeable.
Darkens the Bear Trap.

Spirit.name: Trapper Bag
Spirit.description:
A cured leather waist bag.Large and sturdy to transport hunting equipment.
Increases the number of carried Bear Traps by +1.

Spirit.name: Honing Stone
Spirit.description:
When used with the Bear Trap, the stone sharpens its blades.
The razor-sharp blades inflict deep wounds aimed at bleeding the victim as fast as possible.
Survivors caught in a Bear Trap,  who free themselves, are inflicted with the Dying State.

Spirit.name: Oily Coil
Spirit.description:
A clear oil that makes handling the Bear Trap's spring more hazardous.
Resetting a Bear Trap reveals the Aura of the last Survivor to have disarmed it for 5 seconds.

Spirit.name: Tension Spring
Spirit.description:
A high tension spring that snaps back into place after being stretched.
Automatically resets the Bear Trap 2 seconds after a Survivor escaped from it.

Spirit.name: Trapper Sack
Spirit.description:
A crude leather sack suitable for foraging.
Causes all Bear Traps to be carried in your inventory at the beginning of the Trial.
You can no longer pick up any placed Bear Traps, only reset them.

Spirit.name: Bloody Coil
Spirit.description:
Part sticky, part slippery, this grim liquid makes handling the Bear Traps spring more dangerous.
When a healthy Survivor disarms a Bear Trap, the Bloody Coil exacts its price, putting the Survivor into the Injured State.

Spirit.name: Iridescent Stone
Spirit.description:
Bear Traps sharpened with the sickly gleaming stone seem to gain a life of their own.
Automatically resets and arms a random disarmed Bear Trap every 30 seconds.

Legion.name: Friendship Bracelet
Legion.description:
A wide grey and red braided rope bracelet.The inscription "F. J. S. J." can be seen, crudely written in bold black ink.
Extends the Lunge duration of Feral Slashes by +0.3 seconds, which increases your Attack range.

Legion.name: Mischief List
Legion.description:
A list of mischievous missions to accomplish, memento of brighter days.
Extends the duration of Feral Frenzy by +2 seconds.

Legion.name: Scratched Ruler
Legion.description:
A wooden ruler deeply scratched with hash marks.
Reduces the Recovery time of Feral Frenzy by -5 seconds.

Legion.name: Smiley Face Pin
Legion.description:
A friendly looking, bright yellow button used as a sarcastic statement.
Survivors suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 60 seconds after mending themselves.

Legion.name: Defaced Smiley Pin
Legion.description:
A once friendly looking, bright yellow button of a defaced smiley.A signature icon of The Legion.
Survivors suffer from the Mangled Status Effect for 60 seconds after mending themselves.

Legion.name: Etched Ruler
Legion.description:
A wooden ruler deeply etched with the names of enemies.
Survivors hit with a Feral Slash suffer from the Oblivious Status Effect for 60 seconds.

Legion.name: Julie's Mix Tape
Legion.description:
A dark and depressing mix tape made out from mainly power ballads and gloomy melodies.
Instantly recharges Feral Frenzy after being stunned by any means while using it.
Unlocks an additional sound layer in your Terror Radius, enhancing it musically.
Julie's Mix Tape can be combined with any other Mix Tape Add-on to unlock multiple sound layer combos.

Legion.name: Mural Sketch
Legion.description:
A rough sketch of The Legion mural torn from a notebook.
Increases the stack-able Movement Speed boost gained from chained Feral Slashes to +0.3 m/s, up to a maximum of +1.2 m/s.

Legion.name: Never-Sleep Pills
Legion.description:
Highly caffeinated tablets to make you extra sharp for exams or draining activities.
Extends the duration of Feral Frenzy by +10 seconds.
Reduces the starting Movement speed of Feral Frenzy to 4.6 m/s.
Grants a stack-able +100 bonus Bloodpoints for successful Feral Slashes, up to a maximum of +500.

Legion.name: Joey's Mix Tape
Legion.description:
A mix of bangin' tracks and slammin' beats for chillaxin' when life's a bitch.
Survivors suffer from the Haemorrhage Status Effect until fully healed after mending themselves.
Unlocks an additional sound layer in your Terror Radius, enhancing it musically.
Joey's Mix Tape can be combined with any other Mix Tape Add-on to unlock multiple sound layer combos.

Legion.name: Stolen Sketch Book
Legion.description:
A sketch book with imaginative and evocative, if not slightly bizarre sketches.
Causes Survivors hit with chained Feral Slashes to drop any carried Item.

Legion.name: Stylish Sunglasses
Legion.description:
Oval-shaped sunglasses that exude poise and cool.Their colour-tinted lenses add an understated appeal.
The Auras of Survivors mending themselves within 24 metres of your location are revealed to you.

Legion.name: Susie's Mix Tape
Legion.description:
A fast and thrilling mix tape with energising songs with break-neck beats.
Increases the Detection radius of Killer Instinct by +20 metres.
Unlocks an additional sound layer in your Terror Radius, enhancing it musically.
Susie's Mix Tape can be combined with any other Mix Tape Add-on to unlock multiple sound layer combos.

Legion.name: The Legion Pin
Legion.description:
A handmade button with the face of The Legion.To use exclusively on intimidation dares.
Survivors suffer from the Broken Status Effect for 60 seconds after mending themselves.

Legion.name: BFFs
Legion.description:
An unnaturally cold silver necklace split into four, one for each best friend.
Survivors hit with chained Feral Slashes grant Tokens towards BFFs:
Grants 0 Tokens for the first Feral Slash.
Grants +2 Tokens for the second Feral Slash.
Grants +3 Tokens for the third Feral Slash.
Grants +4 Tokens for the fourth Feral Slash.
Grants +5 Tokens for the fifth Feral Slash.

Once the Exit Gates are powered and BFFs has acquired 15+ Tokens, you benefit from the following effect:
Grants a +6 % Haste Status Effect outside of using Feral Frenzy.

Legion.name: Filthy Blade
Legion.description:
This blade is stained with foul spots of blood and grime that make injuries particularly difficult to mend.
Increases the Mending time of Survivors by +4 seconds.

Legion.name: Frank's Mix Tape
Legion.description:
Never go on a kill mission without your tunes.A track list of massive distortions and loud percussion that stabs at your eardrums.
During Feral Frenzy, you benefit from the following effects:
Pauses the Power Gauge depletion while performing the Break or Damage Action.
Increases the Action speed of damaging Generators by +20 %.
Increases the Action speed of breaking Breakable Walls by +30 %.
Unlocks an additional sound layer in your Terror Radius, enhancing it musically.
Frank's Mix Tape can be combined with any other Mix Tape Add-on to unlock multiple sound layer combos.

Legion.name: Stab Wounds Study
Legion.description:
A printed medical article stolen from Ormond's public library, vulgarising a study on lesions and stab wounds.
The Auras of Survivors are revealed to you for 4 seconds after they mend themselves.

Legion.name: Fuming Mix Tape
Legion.description:
Dark beats, violent shreds and unfathomable vocals from another world fill the mind with a vibrating sixth sense.
During Feral Frenzy, the intensity of Generator Auras reveals their current Repair progress and incomplete Generators start regressing.
Unlocks an additional sound layer in your Terror Radius, enhancing it musically.
The Fuming Mix Tape can be combined with any other Mix Tape Add-on to unlock multiple sound layer combos.

Legion.name: Iridescent Button
Legion.description:
A glass-like button moulded from The Fog that captures The Legion's likeness.The surface is warm and reverberating with The Entity's power.
Causes Feral Vaults to instantly break vaulted Pallets.
"The youth consumed by the iridescent glass magnifies and widens the reach of The Entity."

Plague.name: Cat Figurine
Plague.description:
A wooden figure that had caught young Victor's eye.He shrieked until his mother stole it from the market, nearly blowing their cover.
Unlocks the ability to see the Target location of a Pounce.

Plague.name: Soured Milk
Plague.description:
A metal bottle filled with milk that has since soured.Loud as Victor could be, he quieted down when presented with his meal.
Increases the Shriek radius of Victor by +2 metres.

Plague.name: Tiny Fingernail
Plague.description:
This description is based on the changes featured in the upcoming Patch: 7.7.0Charlotte had many ways to mourn Victor's death.As the fingernails loosened from his rotting hands, she took one in remembrance.
Reduces the Unbinding time of Victor by -0.25 seconds.

Plague.name: Toy Sword
Plague.description:
This description is based on the changes featured in the upcoming Patch: 7.7.0A minuscule toy sword, only a few inches long.Holding it brought out a violent enthusiasm in Victor.
Reduces the Charge time of a Pounce by -0.1 second.

Plague.name: Baby Teeth
Plague.description:
Two teeth that Victor lost long ago.They are unusually sharp.
Survivors suffer from the Blindness Status Effect for 30 seconds after removing Victor.

Plague.name: Bloody Black Hood
Plague.description:
A hood from one of the men that hunted Charlotte.Soon, he became the prey.
Reduces the Transition time when switching back to Charlotte by -0.5 seconds.

Plague.name: Cat's Eye
Plague.description:
An eyeball that belonged to a cat eaten by the starving Deshayes family.Victor hid it from his mother, using it as a toy.
Suppresses all noise made by Victor while holding a Pounce.

Plague.name: Ceremonial Candelabrum
Plague.description:
The candelabrum that Victor tipped over, causing his captors to burn.A symbol of his tenacity.
Increases the Crushing time of Victor by +0.2 seconds when controlling Charlotte.

Plague.name: Madeleine's Glove
Plague.description:
A glove once owned by The Twins' mother.During desperate times, it was held over Victor's mouth to keep him from making a peep.
Increases the Shriek radius of Victor by +4 metres.

Plague.name: Madeleine's Scarf
Plague.description:
A cloth Madeleine wore shortly before her death.The Twins kept it as a memento.
Increases your Movement speed when controlling Victor by +0.3 m/s.
"...shall hereby be recorded as a service to the greater good and the extermination of evil." — Inquiry into the Death of Madeleine Deshayes

Plague.name: Rusted Needle
Plague.description:
This description is based on the changes featured in the upcoming Patch: 7.7.0A needle Madeleine used to sew up her children's tattered clothes.
Survivors hit with a Pounce Attack suffer from the Haemorrhage Status Effect until fully healed.

Plague.name: Sewer Sludge
Plague.description:
This description is based on the changes featured in the upcoming Patch: 7.7.0A disgusting, sticky mixture that covered the Deshayes during an escape attempt through the city sewers.
Reduces the Crawling speed of downed Survivors with Victor attached to them by -25 %.

Plague.name: Stale Biscuit
Plague.description:
A hard, unleavened biscuit that Madeleine stole from a town's market.It was not much, but it was better than most meals.
Reduces the Cool-down time of a Pounce by -0.4 seconds.

Plague.name: Weighty Rattle
Plague.description:
